item.title: [SOLVED]Npc Is Attacking Instead of Talking - How do I change?[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @lord_killord lord killord
item.description:
@lord_killord wrote:

WOOOT I FOUND THE PROBLEM!! AND IT WAS IN THE CLASS 5!!!

It was the line:

class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Talk to";

All i had to do was change the [1] to 0 lolz … wooot! now I can start on my completely custom quest

Ok, I’ve just added in a custom npc for the quest that I’m making, the only problem is that I want him to be the guy you talk to, to start the quest and stuff … however instead of talking he attacks me … -.-

Does anyone know how I can make him talk instead of attack?

I now know it’s in the clickingmost.java … but what do I put in for the case? and do I have to add anything elsewhere aswell?

If this helps => “npc id = 2550” and npcdialogue is: “case 170”

btw: is there any chance it has anything to do with the code in the class 5?

if(i == 2550) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Talk to"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; class5.anIntArray94[0] = 12079; class5.aString65 = "King Pumpkin"; class5.aByteArray89 = "He Looks rich and Powerful".getBytes(); }

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED]Npc Is Attacking Instead of Talking - How do I change?[SOLVED]
